title: Requires manufacturers and labelers of prescription drugs dispensed in this state to annually report marketing expenses to the department of health
summary: Requires manufacturers and labelers of prescription drugs dispensed in this state which engage in marketing activities in the state to annually report marketing expenses to the department of health; imposes a $10,000 civil fine for failure to report; eliminates deductibility for certain expenses incurred in the advertising of prescription drugs.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to requiring the manufacturer or labeler of each prescription drug to annually report the marketing costs of such drug to the department of health and to amend the tax law, in relation to eliminating deductibility for certain expenses incurred in the advertising of prescription drugs
